name: Park Plaza County Hall London

reviews.text: It's the 2nd time I have stayed here and I had my fingers crossed I would get one of the studio rooms again ( the two night trip was booked by work). I was lucky and did. Stayed on the 11th floor which was very quiet. Great room, stylish design, plenty of space / storage, comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, mini kitchenette with expresso coffee maker, free wi-fi. It lacks nothing. Didn't eat in the hotel due to work but the bar is good. Usual central London hotel prices though but a nice selection of bottled beers and ales
reviews.title: Outststanding

reviews.text: Great location for tourists and walking distance from Waterloo
reviews.title: Wow best room have ever stayed in!

reviews.text: No onsite car parking but the NCP under the rail arches is handy. All told its hard to beat
reviews.title: Not 5 star

reviews.text: We have just had weekend in London turned up at hotel around midnight after booking a discount superior room. The reception chap mark was very amusing and we were well greeted. We were upgraded to a penthouse room on 14th floor. It was an amazing room with balcony looking over westminster abbey and bigben. The room comprised of Bedroom with an awesome massive shower a living room area with selection of up todate magasines a kitchen area with espresso maker and microwave. The bed was huge and there were two tvs. I don't know how much this room was usually but next time if we can afford it we will try and get a room there. Just wanted to thank the hotel for making our weeked and mark for sorting us out will be recommending to everyone as really was perfect
reviews.title: Wow! Wonderful hotel experience...

reviews.text: Executive room booked with London eye view very small room with bathroom in centre of room with glass doors no privacy.paid 200 pounds per night no breakfast ncluded.staff ok .not worth the money
reviews.title: GOOD ROOMS, HELPFUL STAFF

reviews.text: I regularly stay at this hotel on business trips. The staff are always very welcoming. Rooms are a good size and always very clean. Any problems I have had with the rooms have addressed quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: Good, central location; nice rooms

reviews.text: Room service is usually very quick and of a reasonable standard although there isn't that much choice. Breakfast is tasty but there are often queues to be seated at peak times.
reviews.title: Very good location for seeing all the sights of London

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to Waterloo station and is ideal as a base for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Within 5 minutes walk of Waterloo station. Staff on arrival very helpful. Allowed us into our room early for our convenience. Hotel very smart looking. Modern and tasteful. Busy but we very served quickly. Room excellent. Large and comfortable. 3 girls sharing. We had a large double room and a sofa bed in a seperate room. 2 TV's and Wi-Fi. Also a kitchen area with microwave and drinks facilities. Beautiful bathroom with huge shower. Our room was on 4th floor and we could see the top of the London Eye. Great location for many attractions. 5 minutes from London Eye and the South Bank area. Just across river from Westminster and the tube.
reviews.title: Fantastic New Years Eve

reviews.text: By sharing your experiences you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!Excellent hotel. This is our second time at this hotel. Lovely rooms, great location. Great for children
reviews.title: Spectacular panoramic views of London

reviews.text: All of the reviews you'll read pretty much sum up our stay. The rate is attractive, family of 4 = £150+VAT is very favourable, location is great, the parking cheap £10 a day, the food as expected albeit pricey etc etc.
reviews.title: Good location, nice view but illness all round

reviews.text: BUT, we had one issue that we haven't really gotten over.
reviews.title: modern, good location, great value for exec package

reviews.text: On check in we were told that the hotel was "fully booked. We ended up in some kind of mini suite; great room size and excellent view of the eye etc. An upgrade well received but a smell of sewage in the bathroom. My 6 year old vomited and no windows to air the room. Fixed by leaving room door open until we, basically, got used to it. We reported this each time we went back into the room and it was such that the problem was the toilet which finally gave up on us <see photo>. By then end, we were all gagging on room entry. Unable to move us we were given a £50 rebate on our bill and offered a free upgrade on our next stay, but one-by-one we all fell sick, so won't be taking the chance again...
reviews.title: Very good hotel, spacious rooms and great location

reviews.text: Pros: Modern, comfortable hotel with nice touches such as an espresso machine.
reviews.title: Dissaopinted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the executive package, i.e. access to the executive lounge is a great value, IMO. Not only are there snacks (muffins, coffee) during the day as well as wine with snacks in pm (olives, nut, pizza-like bread) but you can have a very leisurely breakfast there instead of the crowded dining room. Hardly anyone is there in the morning, the waiters set you up on cozy sofas, bring you your eggs and toast as well as espresso, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent tourist location

reviews.text: I stayed there with my 2 teenage children for 2 days in August. On arrival all the front desk staff were professional, however, they were all foreign and could have been slightly more friendlier/helpful. Had they asked if we needed any help with our stay or advice on where to locate outside amenities I would have felt much more relaxed as this was my first trip to London.
reviews.title: Modern, clean hotel in an excellent central location.

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern and was of a clean standard. We didn't have the best of views but were told after our stay if we had wanted a view looking towards The London Eye etc they would have been happy to move us had one been available, they said the next time we stayed to ask in advance for the view of our choice which is good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a studio room which was very nice and quiet. It had an open room with a double bed, wardrobe and plenty of mirrors. There was a kitchen area next to it with a sink , fridge, mini bar, microwave, tea/coffee facilities, ironing board etc. Next to this was a living room area which doubled up as another bedroom (Settee was a sofa bed). There was a TV and internet access for a fee but was free down in the public areas of the hotel. Opposite the kitchen area was the bathroom which was very modern and nice. There was a bath and a separate shower. In the living area there is a temperature controller and air conditioning. My only problem with the room was that it was quite dark due to the location of being opposite another hotel being built blocking out the sun at the front of the hotel, which would have been rectified had I asked for a room looking out the back of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good price , location and a free upgrade but a few small problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast both days which had an extensive selection of choice, it was served up till 10.30am on weekdays and 11am at weekends. Breakfast was expensive at £13.50 but as children ate for free it was worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but has a few 'niggles'

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. The London eye, Westminster Bridge, House of Parliament / Big Ben are just around a couple of corners. Also, a 24hr shop, cafes and restaurants. Waterloo overground station is just over from the hotel and the nearest underground (tube) station is Westminster which is at the end of Westminster Bridge. You can also catch a boat there for a boat trip down the Thames. Carrying on from the bridge Downing St is nearby and it is easy to make your way to Buckingham Palace from there. From the bridge makes a nice walk to Trafalgar Square etc with lots to see. We went to see the musical Wicked in Victoria which I would recommend. We caught the tube from Westminster to Victoria which was very easy to use and only took a couple of minutes. Children under 12 can use the tube for free.
reviews.title: Not Hygienic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really really really loved this hotel .. I arrived on 24th December, 11 and just left on 01st January 2012 ... I had 9 wonderful and perfect days in this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was excellent .... the room is very comfortable, spacious and beautiful and Thanks Park Plaza County Hall for offer me a amazing view to London Eye .... I could enjoy unforgetables moments there seeing the London Eye and Big Ben .... All staffs of this hotel are very kind .... The breakfast had a lot of options of food and drinks .... everything delicious ...
reviews.title: great hotel choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Time! Great Location! Great Staff! Great Room!

reviews.text: I really recommend ....
reviews.title: Great stay for our family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regards,
reviews.title: Great location, clean, modern, comfy. Nice bar/restaurant open late!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i usually use this hotel for business so on this occasion travelling for pleasure I hoped my positive business experience would justify using this hotel for leisure.
reviews.title: Thanks for the memories

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was completely correct, the hotel is well situated, the service from the staff is excellent and overall this was an excellent experience.
reviews.title: Such an amazing stay!
Recommended staff
reviews.text: We had a studio room which was superb for our needs, the room was clean and tidy with all the extras required.THis hotel is to be highly recommended and it certainly is valuse for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights in one of the penthouse suites - the views were amazing!! The whole hotel gets it just right - this is smart, contemporary done with style and sheer good taste. The location is superb - 3 minutes from either waterloo or embankment tube - but what views - we lay in bed overlooking Big Ben, the River Thames and the London Eye - all of London seemed to be before us!
reviews.title: not that convenient to Waterloo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff team were really friendly and welcoming - they couldn't do enough for us - if you are staying in London, look no further than this great hotel.
reviews.title: Nice location by London Eye, Great Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The city plaza is located just behind The County Hall Complex very near the old International Entrance to Waterloo Station, it’s a very easy walk from Waterloo tube. We got there and were very pleased to be upgraded to a suite “since it’s your first time with us”. The suite was delightful with a very comfortable bed and useful kitchenette including a microwave and fridge and a nice lounge.
reviews.title: Great hotel - with staff that really care

reviews.text: As others have said the location is excellent. We booked because we were going to the National Theatre in the South Bank Complex which is a very pleasant 10 minute stroll down the river side.
reviews.title: Good location, great rooms.

reviews.text: All the staff we came across couldn’t have been more helpful and friendly and seemed to really care that we should want to come back again. Actually this was our second choice over our normal London pick the City Inn Westminster which is also excellent. On balance I would just give it to the City Plaza County Hall on location though in fairness it might be different if we had stay in the non-upgraded room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Perfect location to visit London.

reviews.text: Quibbles? Yes the lifts were a bit slow during the peak times and charging £9for the internet in rooms is a bit steep these days.
reviews.title: Incedible Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, though, if you want a modern 4 star functional hotel in a good location you are not going to find many better in London especially at the price.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: When we arrived, staff was very helpful and friendly. Since we arrived early, our room wasn't ready yet and we got free drinks at the bar while we were waiting, We also got a great upgrade.
reviews.title: London weekend

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good and service professional.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel, immaculate condition, with friendly staff!

reviews.text: I can recommend this hotel to everyone; we enjoyed it very much
reviews.title: New Year

reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel as a family of 3, on 6th December '11 and stayed for 2 nights. We arrived around 12 noon. When we first got there our first impressions were that the staff were brilliant and couldn't do enough for us, our room wasn't ready for about an hour or so, so we went for a walk to a restaurant for some food. We then went back and got to our room, our cases were brought to the room for us. We had a great view of the London eye, which looks brilliant lit up at night. We then ordered room service for our 3 year old (as she slept while we went for lunch) she had fish fingers peas and chips, which was at the room within about 20 minutes, she enjoyed the meal too. That night we went to watch 'the lion king' show in Covent garden, we walked there and it only took about 15 mins (that was a slow stroll) and was a lovely walk over the Thames. Also, we pre-ordered our breakfast to the room ready for the next morning, which arrived right on the time we selected, it was yummy! As we had bed & breakfast included, it cost £3.00 to get delivered to our room, I think this is reasonable as some hotels will rip you off with this service and charge up to £15.00. Didn't use gym etc. as we were up and out by 9 and didn't get home until about 10.30 every night, so didn't really have time. Beds were extremely comfy, Bathroom was lovely and spacious, Nothing bad to say about hotel. Staff couldn't do enough for us. Christmas decorations everywhere which my daughter and partner loved, would definitely recommend! Also recommend London eye, aquarium, definitely a show in Covent garden, and Chinatown. Winter wonderland was also amazing for us. It was our first time as a family to London and we are thinking of doing the same this year (2012) close to Christmas again. Thank you to all at Park Plaza.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - let down by the Dining

reviews.text: Just returned from this hotel and it was great. The hotel is spotless the staff are very friendly and the location is a must for anyone going for New Year. We were in room 1331 and the view of the London Eye was spectacular. It was like having it in your back garden. The firework display was absolutely amazing. The breakfast in the hotel is fantastic and once again great staff service. The only thing that let it down was the New Years Eve meal. It was supposed to be a gala buffet but there wasn`t very much selection. What there was of it was excellent. I would completely recommend this hotel for everything and would return there myself anytime. It is in the heart of everything with easy access to anywhere from the nearby Waterloo Station.
reviews.title: Great hotel with central location

aka: Park Plaza County Hall London Hotel London
description: Park Plaza County Hall is conveniently located on the south side of the River Thames near Waterloo Station and is next to London's County Hall, home to several attractions, including the London Sea Life Aquarium. The hotel is within minutes of a number of local attractions, including the London Eye (walking distance), Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. Our London accommodation features modern guest rooms, six well-equipped meeting rooms with natural daylight, Restaurant & Bar, an Executive Lounge and a Fitness Centre. Choose Park Plaza County Hall and see what makes us one of the top London Waterloo hotels.
